sen.j: 塩辛（しおから）は、魚介類の身を、多くの場合その内臓とともに塩漬けにし腐敗を防止するとともに、酵素（自己消化酵素及び内含する微生物が持つもの）によって発酵、熟成した保存食品である。
sen.e: Shiokara is a preserved food made from flesh of seafood, salted mostly with the guts in order to prevent corruption, fermented and matured with the aid of enzyme (autolyzed enzyme and one possessed by internal microorganisms).

Shiokara is a preserved food made from flesh of seafood, salted mostly with the guts in order to prevent rot, fermented and matured with the aid of enzymes (an autolyzed enzyme and ones possessed by the internal microorganisms).
sen.cmt: corruptionをrotに変更。その他、単語の単複、冠詞の見直し。
sen.e: Shiokara is a preserved food made from flesh of seafood, salted mostly with the guts in order to prevent rot, fermented and matured with the aid of enzymes (an autolyzed enzyme and ones possessed by the internal microorganisms).

sen.j: 内臓に含まれる酵素以外に、発酵を促進するために麹を加える場合もある。
sen.e: For the purpose of facilitating fermentation, koji (malted rice) is sometimes added, besides enzyme included in the guts.
For the purpose of facilitating fermentation, koji (malted rice) is sometimes added, besides enzymes included in the guts.
For the purpose of facilitating fermentation, koji (malted rice) is sometimes added, besides enzymes included in the guts.

sen.j: 古くは『今昔物語』に塩辛との文字が現れるが、江戸期以降の塩辛と同じものと確認できないことと、時代的に孤立していることから、初出は『日葡辞書』とするのが妥当と考えられる。
sen.e: The oldest reference to Shiokara is seen in "Konjaku Monogatari " (The Tale of Times Now Past), but we cannot confirm that it is the same as the Shiokara which appeared during the Edo period and there was too long a span of time between those appearances of Shiokara, so it would be appropriate to determine that Shiokara appeared in "Nippo jisho" (Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) for the first time.

The oldest reference to shiokara is seen in "Konjaku Monogatari " (The Tale of Times Now Past), but it cannot be confirmed that it is the same as the shiokara which was eaten during and after the Edo period and the age of konjaku Monogatari was historically isolated from other ages, so it would be appropriate to determine that shiokara appeared in "Nippo jisho" (a Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) for the first time.
sen.cmt: 文の構成全体の見直し
sen.e: The oldest reference to shiokara is seen in "Konjaku Monogatari " (The Tale of Times Now Past), but it cannot be confirmed that it is the same as the shiokara which was eaten during and after the Edo period and the age of konjaku Monogatari was historically isolated from other ages, so it would be appropriate to determine that shiokara appeared in "Nippo jisho" (a Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) for the first time.

sen.j: 16世紀から記録が確認できる『なし物』との併用がしばらく続いた後、江戸中期後半以降に塩辛という名称で定着した。
sen.e: Salted fish guts are shown by documents to have been also called "Nashi-mono" for a long time after the 16th century, but the name Shiokara became popular after the latter half of the mid Edo period.
Salted fish guts are shown in documents to have been also called "nashi-mono" for a long time since the 16th century, and the name "shiokara" became popular in the latter half of the mid Edo period.
Salted fish guts are shown in documents to have been also called "nashi-mono" for a long time since the 16th century, and the name "shiokara" became popular in the latter half of the mid Edo period.

sen.j: 文献には、やや訛った『しょうから』（鳥取市）や、『しょから』（志摩市）の事例が掲載されている。
sen.e: A little accented "Shookara" (Tottori City) and "Shokara" (Shima City) can be seen in documents.
Local accents "shookara" (Tottori City) and "shokara" (Shima City) can be seen in documents.
sen.cmt: little accented を local accentsに変更
sen.e: Local accents "shookara" (Tottori City) and "shokara" (Shima City) can be seen in documents.

sen.j: 魚介肉及び内臓の約10%以上から飽和量の食塩を添加するのが一般的な製法とされてきたが、20世紀末頃からの健康志向に伴い、塩分が低い塩辛も製造・販売されるようになった。
sen.e: The common recipe was to add salt weighing from about ten percent to the saturation level of the flesh and guts of fish and shellfish, but reflecting heath concerns since the end of the 20th century, Shiokara with less salt started to be produced and sold.

The common recipe was to add salt weighing from about ten percent to the saturation level of the flesh and guts of fish and shellfish; however, reflecting heath concerns since the end of the 20th century, shiokara with less salt has been produced and sold as well.
sen.cmt: 文の構成全体の見直し
sen.e: The common recipe was to add salt weighing from about ten percent to the saturation level of the flesh and guts of fish and shellfish; however, reflecting heath concerns since the end of the 20th century, shiokara with less salt has been produced and sold as well.

sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

tit.cmt: 表題なので個々の単語の先頭を大文字化（除く前置詞）

sen.j: - イカの身の細切りに、内臓、塩を和えて造る。
sen.e: Shredded flesh of squid is dressed with the guts and salt.
made by shredding the flesh of squid and dressing with the guts and salt.
made by shredding the flesh of squid and dressing with the guts and salt.

sen.j: タコでも同様に作られる。
sen.e: Octopus can be made into Shiokara in the same manner.
Octopuses can be made into shiokara in the same manner.
sen.cmt: Octopusesとした (Octopusは可算名詞)。Shiokaraをshiokaraとした。
sen.e: Octopuses can be made into shiokara in the same manner.

Shiokara of takomanma (spawn of Paroctopus dofleini and Octopus conispadiceus).

sen.j: 北海道白糠町などで作られる。

Mostly made in Shiranuka-cho, Hokkaido.
Mostly made in Shiranuka-cho, Hokkaido.

tit.cmt: 単語の先頭を大文字化

sen.j: - ホッコクアカエビなど中型のエビをそのまま塩蔵したもの。
sen.e: Middle-sized shrimps including Pandalus eous (deep-water shrimp) are salted whole.
Salted shripms are made by salting down middle-size shrimps such as Pandalus eous (a deep-water shrimp) while the shrimps keeping the original shape.
Salted shripms are made by salting down middle-size shrimps such as Pandalus eous (a deep-water shrimp) while the shrimps keeping the original shape.

sen.j: 塩辛アミの塩辛 アキアミ、イサザアミ、ツノナシオキアミなどを丸ごと塩蔵したもの。
sen.e: Shiokara of salted mysid shrimp; mysid shrimps such as Actes japonicus, Neomysis intermedia and Euphausia pacifica are salted whole.
Shiokara of mysid shrimp: made by salting down mysid shrimps such as Actes japonicus, Neomysis intermedia and Euphausia pacifica while the shrimps keeping the original shape.
Shiokara of mysid shrimp: made by salting down mysid shrimps such as Actes japonicus, Neomysis intermedia and Euphausia pacifica while the shrimps keeping the original shape.

sen.j: 詳細は後述。

sen.j: - シオマネキ、ヤマトオサガニ、アリアケガニなど、干潟に産する小型のカニを潰し塩辛にする。
sen.e: Small-sized crabs caught in mudflats such as Uca arcuata, Marcophthalmus japonicus and Cleistostoma dilatatum are crushed and salted.
made by crushing and salting down the small-size crabs caught in mudflats such as Uca arcuata, Marcophthalmus japonicus and Cleistostoma dilatatum.
made by crushing and salting down the small-size crabs caught in mudflats such as Uca arcuata, Marcophthalmus japonicus and Cleistostoma dilatatum.

shuto (salted and fermented bonito intestines) in Kochi Prefecture and others.
shuto (salted and fermented bonito intestines) in Kochi Prefecture and others.

sen.j: ただし、「酒盗」と「かつお（かつを）の塩辛」とは風味が大きく異なる。

However, shuto differs greatly from the salted bonito in flavor.

shiokara of cod (salted pacific cod): made by salting down the spawn of Gadidae (a family of fish including cod, haddock, whiting and pollack) until it is fermented.

sen.j: 大韓民国ではチョッカルまたはチョッと称し、キムチを漬ける際の調味料として欠かせないものである。
sen.e: Shiokara is called Chokkaru or Cho in the Republic of Korea and an essential ingredient for pickling kimchi.
Shiokara is called chokkaru or cho in the Republic of Korea and is essential seasoning in pickling kimchi.
Shiokara is called chokkaru or cho in the Republic of Korea and is essential seasoning in pickling kimchi.

sen.e: salted sea urchin: It is made from sea urchin called Kusaru in Jeju.

tit.cmt: 出現単語の先頭を大文字化

sen.j: スルメイカを使うことが多い。
sen.e: It is mostly made from a Japanese common flying squid.
It is mostly made from a Japanese common flying squid.
It is mostly made from a Japanese common flying squid.

sen.j: 伝統的なイカの塩辛は、大きく分けて以下の3種類に分類できる。
sen.e: The traditional salted squids can be roughly classified into the following three;
Traditional salted squids can be roughly classified into the following three.
sen.cmt: traditinal salted squidsから定冠詞を除去。また、セミコロンをピリオドに変更。
sen.e: Traditional salted squids can be roughly classified into the following three.

sen.j: 白造り
sen.e: shiro-tsukuri (made in white)
Shiro-Tsukuri (made in white)
sen.cmt: 見出しなので大文字化
sen.e: Shiro-Tsukuri (made in white)

sen.j: - イカ肉と塩のみで発酵させる。
sen.e: Only the flesh of squid with salt is fermented.
Only the flesh of squid with salt is fermented.
Only the flesh of squid with salt is fermented.

sen.j: 見た目は刺身に近く、白い。
sen.e: It looks like sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), and is whitish.
It looks like sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), and is whitish.
It looks like sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), and is whitish.

sen.j: 赤造り
sen.e: aka-tsukuri (made in red)
Aka-Tsukuri (made in red)
sen.cmt: 見出しなので大文字化
sen.e: Aka-Tsukuri (made in red)

sen.j: - イカ肉、肝（内臓：中腸腺）、塩を混合して発酵させる。
sen.e: The flesh and liver (guts: midgut gland) of squid, mixed with salt, are fermented.
The flesh and liver (guts: midgut gland) of squid are mixed with salt and fermented.
The flesh and liver (guts: midgut gland) of squid are mixed with salt and fermented.

sen.j: 仕上がりは赤い。
sen.e: When completed, it is reddish.
When completed, it is reddish.
When completed, it is reddish.

sen.j: 最も一般的な形。
sen.e: It is the most common type of salted squid.
It is the most common type of salted squid.
It is the most common type of salted squid.

sen.j: 黒造り
sen.e: kuro-tsukuri (made in black)
Kuro-Tsukuri (made in black)
sen.cmt: 見出しなので大文字化
sen.e: Kuro-Tsukuri (made in black)

sen.j: - イカ肉、肝（内臓：中腸腺）、イカスミ、塩を混合して発酵させる。
sen.e: The flesh, liver (guts: midgut gland) and ink of squid, mixed with salt, are fermented.
The flesh, liver (guts: midgut gland) and ink of squid are mixed with salt and fermented.
The flesh, liver (guts: midgut gland) and ink of squid are mixed with salt and fermented.

sen.j: 仕上がりは黒い。
sen.e: When completed, it is black.
When completed, it is black.
When completed, it is black.

sen.j: 利用は一部の地方のみ。
sen.e: It is eaten only in limited areas.
It is eaten in limited areas.
It is eaten in limited areas.

sen.j: 富山県などが産地。
sen.e: It is produced mainly in Toyama Prefecture.
It is produced mainly in Toyama Prefecture.
It is produced mainly in Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: 発酵に要する時間は下にいくほど長くなる。
sen.e: As the number of ingredients increases, fermentation takes longer.
Fermentation takes longer progreesively toward lower layers of the ingredients.
Fermentation takes longer progreesively toward lower layers of the ingredients.

sen.j: また、うま味も下にいくほど濃厚である。
sen.e: And salted squid has richer flavor as well.
And the taste and flavor is further enriched progressively toward the lower layers of the ingredients.
And the taste and flavor is further enriched progressively toward the lower layers of the ingredients.

sen.j: イカの塩辛の発酵は微生物による働きに加え、内臓（おもに中腸腺）に含まれる消化酵素によって自己消化が起こり、アミノ酸が生成する働きも重要な役割を果たしている。
sen.e: Fermentation of salted squid is promoted by microorganisms, but a greater part is played by the process in which digestive enzymes contained in guts (mainly midgut gland) cause autodigestion, resulting in production of amino acids.

Fermentation of salted squid is promoted by work of microorganisms, in addition, a vital role is played by the process in which digestive enzymes contained in guts (mainly midgut gland) cause autodigestion, resulting in production of amino acid.

Fermentation of salted squid is promoted by work of microorganisms, in addition, a vital role is played by the process in which digestive enzymes contained in guts (mainly midgut gland) cause autodigestion, resulting in production of amino acid.

sen.j: 塩分は伝統的な製法の場合8-12%程度、近年の大量生産品は4-8%である。
sen.e: The concentration of salt is 8-12% in the case of the traditional recipe, and 4-8% in the case of today's mass-produced items.
The concentration of salt is 8-12% in the case of the traditional recipe, and 4-8% in the case of today's mass-produced items.
The concentration of salt is 8-12% in the case of the traditional recipe, and 4-8% in the case of today's mass-produced items.

tit.cmt: 単語の先頭の大文字化

sen.j: アミの塩辛は、日本の有明海沿岸、中華人民共和国、香港の長洲島、マカオ、韓国など東アジア各地で作られ、調味料として使用される。
sen.e: Salted mysid shrimp, produced in many East Asian areas such as the Sea of Ariake Coasts (Japan), People's Republic of China, Cheung Chan Island (Hong Kong), Macau and Korea, is used as seasoning.

The salted mysid shrimp is produced and used as seasonong in many areas in East Asia such as the Sea of Ariake Coasts (Japan), People's Republic of China, Cheung Chan Island (Hong Kong), Macau and South Korea.

The salted mysid shrimp is produced and used as seasonong in many areas in East Asia such as the Sea of Ariake Coasts (Japan), People's Republic of China, Cheung Chan Island (Hong Kong), Macau and South Korea.

sen.j: ここで多用されるのはアキアミやその近縁種だが、これらは厳密にはアミではなくエビの仲間である。
sen.e: Actes japonicus and its related species are used to produce this kind of Shiokara, but strictly speaking, they are a kind of shrimp, not of mysid shrimp.
Actes japonicus and its related species are used to produce this kind of Shiokara, but strictly speaking, they are a kind of shrimp, not of mysid shrimp.
Actes japonicus and its related species are used to produce this kind of Shiokara, but strictly speaking, they are a kind of shrimp, not of mysid shrimp.

sen.j: イサザアミ（アミ (甲殻類)目）やツノナシオキアミ（オキアミ目）などの塩辛も存在するが、アキアミほど流通していない。
sen.e: Neomysis intermedia (mysidopsis bahia, Crustacea) and Euphausia pacifica (Euphausiacea) are sometimes made into Shiokara, but their Shiokara is not as common as that of Actes japonicus.
Neomysis intermedia (mysidopsis bahia, Crustacea) and Euphausia pacifica (Euphausiacea) are sometimes made into Shiokara, but their Shiokara is not as common as that of Actes japonicus.
Neomysis intermedia (mysidopsis bahia, Crustacea) and Euphausia pacifica (Euphausiacea) are sometimes made into Shiokara, but their Shiokara is not as common as that of Actes japonicus.

sen.j: 香港のものは「蝦醤」（ハージョン）といい、野菜の炒め物やスープの調味に使われる。
sen.e: Salted mysid shrimp in Hong Kong, called "Hajon," is used for seasoning sautéed vegetables and soups.
Salted mysid shrimp in Hong Kong, called "hajon," is used for seasoning sautéed vegetables and soups.
Salted mysid shrimp in Hong Kong, called "hajon," is used for seasoning sautéed vegetables and soups.

sen.j: 中国浙江省寧波では、ゆでたサトイモにつけて食べる。
sen.e: Salted mysid shrimp is put on boiled satoimo (taro) and eaten in Ningbo, Zhejiang Province, China.
Salted mysid shrimp is put on boiled satoimo (taro) and eaten in Ningbo, Zhejiang Province, China.
Salted mysid shrimp is put on boiled satoimo (taro) and eaten in Ningbo, Zhejiang Province, China.

sen.j: 韓国ではセウジョッ（）といい、キムチを漬ける際に、発酵を促進し、アミノ酸のうま味を加える目的で使われる。
sen.e: In Korea, it is called Seujo and used to facilitate fermentation and enhance the flavor of amino acid in pickling kimchi.
In South Korea, it is called seujo and used to facilitate fermentation and enhance the flavor of amino acid in pickling kimchi.
In South Korea, it is called seujo and used to facilitate fermentation and enhance the flavor of amino acid in pickling kimchi.

sen.j: フィリピンではバゴーン（bagoong）といい、料理の調味に使われる。
sen.e: In Philippines, it is called "Bagoong" and used for seasoning food.
In the Philippines, it is called "bagoong" and used for seasoning food.
In the Philippines, it is called "bagoong" and used for seasoning food.

sen.j: 特にカレカレ（kare kare、牛テールと野菜をピーナッツソースで煮込んだ料理）の調味には欠かせないとされる。
sen.e: In particular, it is said to be indispensable for seasoning karekare, a dish of oxtail and vegetables stewed in peanut sauce.
In particular, it is said to be indispensable for seasoning karekare, a dish of oxtail and vegetables stewed in peanut sauce.
In particular, it is said to be indispensable for seasoning karekare, a dish of oxtail and vegetables stewed in peanut sauce.

sen.j: 居酒屋などではそのまま、あるいは大根おろしなどと合わせ肴として出す店が多い。
sen.e: In many izakaya bars, salted mysid shrimp is served as sakana (appetizers taken with alcoholic drinks), eaten as it is or with grated daikon radish.
In many izakaya bars, salted mysid shrimp is served as sakana (appetizers taken with alcoholic drinks), eaten as it is or with grated daikon radish.
In many izakaya bars, salted mysid shrimp is served as sakana (appetizers taken with alcoholic drinks), eaten as it is or with grated daikon radish.

sen.j: 家庭では、ご飯にのせて食べたり、茶漬けにする例がある。
sen.e: In homes, it is eaten with boiled rice, sometimes with tea poured over it.
In homes, it is eaten with boiled rice, sometimes with tea poured over it.
In homes, it is eaten with boiled rice, sometimes with tea poured over it.

sen.j: 蛋白質が分解されてアミノ酸を生じ、旨みを含むことから、鍋料理などの隠し味として加える例もある。
sen.e: It is sometimes added to one-pot dishes as a hidden flavor because the protein contained in it is broken down into amid acids and makes the dishes tastier.
It is sometimes added to one-pot dishes as a hidden flavor because the protein contained in it is broken down into amid acids and makes the dishes tastier.
It is sometimes added to one-pot dishes as a hidden flavor because the protein contained in it is broken down into amid acids and makes the dishes tastier.

sen.j: 北海道では蒸かしたジャガイモにイカの塩辛を乗せて食べることもある。
sen.e: In Hokkaido, salted squid is sometimes eaten with boiled potatoes.
In Hokkaido, salted squid is sometimes eaten with boiled potatoes.
In Hokkaido, salted squid is sometimes eaten with boiled potatoes.

sen.j: 近年はキムチ塩辛なども販売されている。
sen.e: "Kimchi Shiokara" is being sold these days.
Salted kimchi sells these days as well.
Salted kimchi sells these days as well.
